decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The deck includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Daze to protect the combo, as well as cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to help find key pieces. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides additional card advantage and selection. The inclusion of cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal allow for fast mana acceleration, while Murktide Regent offers a backup win condition. The mana base is designed to support the deck's requirements while also disrupting the opponent's resources.

This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudpost lands and Planar Nexus to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. It also utilizes Artifact support cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Chalice of the Void to control the board and disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck includes counterspells like Force of Will for protection and card draw spells like Stock Up to maintain card advantage. The combination of ramp, disruption, and powerful threats makes this deck a formidable opponent in the Legacy format.

The main idea of this deck is to fill your graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp using cards like Breakthrough and Faithless Looting, then bring them back from the graveyard with cards like Dread Return and generate zombie tokens with Bridge from Below. Utilizing Lion's Eye Diamond for mana acceleration and Otherworldly Gaze for card advantage, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a large board presence and win condition through cards like Thassa's Oracle or Satoru, the Infiltrator.

The main idea of this deck is to use Show and Tell to put powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play for free, enabling a game-winning combo with Omniscience. The deck includes protection spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to ensure the combo can go off smoothly, along with card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the necessary pieces. Cunning Wish allows for additional flexibility and access to sideboard options. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and removal spells, all while taking advantage of the ramp and consistency provided by the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring. The deck aims to quickly apply pressure with efficient creatures like Amped Raptor and Guide of Souls, while using cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Swords to Plowshares to control the board. With a mix of land destruction and disruption cards like Static Prison and Wasteland, the deck seeks to keep the opponent on the back foot while delivering the finishing blow.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing the powerful land Gaea's Cradle to generate mana and ramp into big threats like Craterhoof Behemoth and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. The deck also includes various creatures with adaptability (such as Allosaurus Shepherd and Collector Ouphe) and strong tutoring abilities (such as Fiend Artisan and Green Sun's Zenith) to ensure consistency in finding key cards. With a mix of creature threats, mana acceleration, and disruption, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck combines aggressive creatures with disruptive elements to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Skyclave Apparition, the deck aims to dismantle the opponent's strategy while deploying powerful threats like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. With Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and Wasteland to disrupt mana bases, this deck aims to pressure the opponent while keeping them off-balance with disruption and removal spells. Additionally, the inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion provides additional value and flexibility to the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the "Show and Tell" combo to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Atraxa, Grand Unifier quickly and for free. This strategy is supported by a suite of card draw and control spells like Brainstorm, Thoughtseize, and Force of Will to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes various lands to support its mana base and ensure it can cast its spells efficiently.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor combo, allowing the player to mill their entire library and win with Thassa's Oracle. The deck includes protection spells like Force of Will and Daze, as well as disruption with Cabal Therapy and Swords to Plowshares. It also utilizes Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Urza's Saga to find key combo pieces. The deck's strategy revolves around efficiently setting up and executing the combo while disrupting the opponent, leading to a swift victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive Eldrazi creatures while disrupting their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. With a combination of powerful creatures and disruptive spells, the deck aims to quickly close out games and prevent the opponent from effectively playing their own cards. The deck also includes mana acceleration with cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb to help get the big Eldrazi creatures out faster. The mana base is designed to support the Eldrazi creatures and to maximize efficiency in casting them.

The deck focuses on using lands as control pieces to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also building towards a win condition with cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. It utilizes cards like Crop Rotation and Life from the Loam to efficiently bring out key lands and maintain card advantage. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Grafdigger's Cage and Pithing Needle further enhances the deck's ability to control the board. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent through efficient land usage and disruption, ultimately leading to a win through powerful land-based combos.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The key strategy is to apply pressure early with fast creatures like Amped Raptor and Orcish Bowmasters, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize. The deck also includes removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to deal with threats, and a combination of Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Goblin Bombardment for additional damage output. The mana base is optimized for consistent casting of spells and provides flexibility in color requirements.

This Legacy deck focuses on utilizing the card Show and Tell to quickly put powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play. The deck also includes cards like Sneak Attack and Omniscience to cheat big threats onto the battlefield. With a combination of ramp cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide, as well as disruption cards like Force of Will, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its fast combo potential and hard-to-answer threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate a large amount of mana using rituals and mana accelerants such as Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal, while using cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for combo pieces. The deck aims to assemble the Storm combo by casting multiple spells in a row, eventually finishing the opponent off with a Tendrils of Agony. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Duress and Veil of Summer to protect the combo. The inclusion of Wishclaw Talisman and Infernal Tutor allows the deck to search for specific combo pieces when needed.

The deck focuses on utilizing fast mana acceleration cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal to generate a large amount of mana quickly. The goal is to cast multiple spells in a single turn using rituals like Cabal Ritual and Dark Ritual, while also controlling the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize. The deck aims to generate enough storm count to finish the game with Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam, while also utilizing Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard for additional value. The deck also includes cards like Brainstorm and Ponder for card selection and manipulation.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells, creatures, and disruptive elements to apply pressure and control the tempo of the game. By using cards like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler to quickly establish a board presence, alongside powerful control spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect your threats, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. Mishra's Bauble and cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder provide additional card selection and fuel for Delirium for Murktide Regent. This deck is all about being proactive and aggressive while still maintaining control over the game.
